alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 29 at 9:58AM MST until December 30 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected with localized reductions in visibility to one-half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 6 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
